element.name: Art Deco Dublin: Noblett's Sweet Shop by Bootle, Traditional Cache (2/1)
element.long-description:
This cache is one in a series highlighting some of Dublin's finest examples of Art Deco architecture. The design movement, which was popular roughly between the two world wars, never had an enormous impact in Ireland. Nevertheless many beautiful buildings were constructed along Art Deco lines, and while many have been demolished, there are still several fine examples to be seen in modern Dublin. This series of caches will bring you to several examples, but is not intended to be a comprehensive list.
The structure of Art Deco is based on mathematical geometric shapes. It was widely considered to be an eclectic form of elegant and stylish modernism, being influenced by a variety of sources. Among them were the so-called "primitive" arts of Africa, Ancient Egypt, and Aztec Mexico, as well as machine-age or streamline technology such as modern aviation, electric lighting, the radio, the ocean liner and the skyscraper.
Art Deco design influences were expressed in fractionated, crystalline, faceted forms of decorative Cubism and Futurism. Other popular themes in Art Deco were trapezoidal, zigzagged, geometric, and jumbled shapes, which can be seen in many early pieces. These were the buildings of the future: sleek, geometric, dramatic. With their cubic forms and zigzag designs, art deco buildings embraced the machine age.
This building, at the top of Grafton Street, once housed Nobletts Sweet shop. It was built at some point in the 1930s and, despite its distinctive tower, is often overlooked by the throngs that pass by it every day. Today it houses a newsagents shop.
This cache is a nano. It is placed away from the building itself, in a marginally quiter location! Stealth is required in this urban location, and please be aware of the many people who pass by this busy spot. You may have to find this cache by touch, rather than by sight!
Sources -
Art Deco Ireland
Archiseek
Retropolis
Architecture.com
element.encoded-hints: SS Green West; where railing meets wall
element.url-name: Art Deco Dublin: Noblett's Sweet Shop

ul.li:
2010-06-16T19:00:00Z : Found it by momentforus
With Happy2006 and Snoop Doggy Dee on our trip to Ireland. Found pretty quickly SL TFTH

2010-06-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by sina1507
Found together with scheff on our second day in Dublin. TFTC sina1507 from germany

2010-06-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by scheff
Found together with sina1507 on our second day in Dublin. TFTC scheff from germany

2010-06-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by Die-3-Fragezeichen
Last night the coords lead me closer to the nice building and a muggle didn't allow me one further more potential hide. Today I got it with one grab, smile. TFTC and greetings from Germany, 3??? btw, very nice park!

2010-06-06T19:00:00Z : Found it by de Bontjes
Together with 4-voeters we've searched the place around, well hidden this one! T4tc.

2008-10-16T19:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
A fast find, with some nearby horses providing a strong smell-screen. Log is jammed full.

2008-10-16T16:37:16Z : Needs Maintenance by Kersti.com
Log book full
